sen.j: 蛇塚古墳（へびづかこふん）は、京都府京都市右京区太秦にある古墳。
sen.e: Hebizuka Kofun is a tumulus located in Uzumasa, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Hebizuka Kofun is a tumulus located in Uzumasa, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Hebizuka-kofun Tumulus is a tumulus located in Uzumasa, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 京都府下でも最大の横穴式石室をもつ前方後円墳である。
sen.e: It is a large keyhole-shaped mound with the largest horizontal stone chamber in Kyoto Prefecture.
It is a large keyhole-shaped mound with the largest horizontal stone chamber in Kyoto Prefecture.
It is a large keyhole-shaped mound with the largest horizontal stone chamber in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 国の史跡に指定されている（1977年5月4日指定）。
sen.e: It was designated as a national historical site (on May 4, 1977).
It was designated as a national historical site (on May 4, 1977).
It was designated as a national historical site (on May 4, 1977).

sen.j: 墳丘の長さは約75メートルあったと推測されている。
sen.e: The length of the tumulus is estimated to be approximately 75 m.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The length of the tumulus is estimated to be approximately 75 m.
The length of the tumulus is estimated to be approximately 75 m.

sen.j: 封土は失われて後円部の石室のみが露出している。
sen.e: The burial mound is now lost and the stone chamber is solely exposed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The burial mound is now lost and the stone chamber is solely exposed.
The burial mound is now lost and the stone chamber is solely exposed.

sen.j: 石室の全長は17.8m。
sen.e: The chamber has the total length of 17.8 m.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The chamber has the total length of 17.8 m.
The chamber has the total length of 17.8 m.

sen.j: 玄室の長さ6.8m、玄室の高さ5.2m。
sen.e: The burial chamber is 6.8 m long and 5.2 m high.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The burial chamber is 6.8 m long and 5.2 m high.
The burial chamber is 6.8 m long and 5.2 m high.

sen.j: 明日香村の石舞台古墳に匹敵する大きさである。
sen.e: It is as large as the Ishibutai-kofun Tumulus in Asuka-mura.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is as large as the Ishibutai-kofun Tumulus in Asuka-mura.
It is as large as the Ishibutai-kofun Tumulus in Asuka Village.

sen.j: 床の部分の面積で比較すると日本で第4位の規模である。
sen.e: Its floor space is the forth largest in Japan.
Its floor space is the forth largest in Japan.
Its floor space is the forth largest in Japan.

sen.j: 石室部分のみ国の史跡に指定されている。
sen.e: Only the stone chamber is specified as a national historical site.
Only the stone chamber is specified as a national historical site.
Only the stone chamber is specified as a national historical site.

sen.j: 現在は崩落の危険があるため石室内部は鉄枠で補強されている。
sen.e: Its interior is now reinforced by a steel frame to prevent it from caving in.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Its interior is now reinforced with a steel frame to prevent it from caving in.
Its interior is now reinforced with a steel frame to prevent it from caving in.

sen.j: 石室の周囲はフェンスで囲われて施錠され、普段は出入りできないようになっている。
sen.e: Surrounded by the fences, it is bolted so that no one can enter under usual circumstances.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Surrounded by a fence, it is bolted so that no one can enter under usual circumstances.
Surrounded by a fence, it is bolted so that no one can enter under usual circumstances.

sen.j: 古墳時代後期の6世紀末から7世紀頃の築造とされる。
sen.e: The tumulus was constructed in the late 6th century to the early 7th which is the late Kofun (Tumulus) period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The tumulus was constructed in the late 6th century to the early 7th which is the late Kofun (Tumulus) period.
The tumulus was constructed in the late sixth century to the early seventh which is the late Kofun (Tumulus) period.
sen.cmt: スペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 現存する京都府の前方後円墳としては最後期に属する。
sen.e: As an extant keyhole-shaped tumulus in Kyoto Prefecture it belongs to the very end of the period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As an extant keyhole-shaped tumulus in Kyoto Prefecture it belongs to the very end of the period.
As an extant keyhole-shaped tumulus in Kyoto Prefecture it belongs to the very end of the period.

sen.j: 被葬者は不明であるが、秦氏一族の首長クラスの人物ではないかと考えられている。
sen.e: While the buried is not identified, it has been assumed that he was a chief-like personage of the Hata family.
While the buried have not been identified, it has been assumed that he was a chief-like personage of the Hata family.
While the buried have not been identified, it has been assumed that he was a chief-like personage of the Hata clan.

sen.j: 被葬者を秦河勝とみる説もある。
sen.e: Some have identified him as HATA no Kawakatsu.
Some have identified him as HATA no Kawakatsu.
Some have identified him as HATA no Kawakatsu.

sen.j: 京福電気鉄道 帷子ノ辻駅より南に徒歩約7分
sen.e: Approximately 7-minute walk south of Katabiranotsuji Station, the Keifuku Electric Railroad.
Approximately 7-minute walk south of Katabiranotsuji Station, the Keifuku Electric Railroad.
Approximately seven-minute walk south of Katabiranotsuji Station, the Keifuku Electric Railroad.
sen.cmt: スペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 住宅地の中にあり場所はきわめて分かりにくい
sen.e: Located in the middle of a residential area, the tumulus is not so easy to find.
Located in the middle of a residential area, the tumulus is not so easy to find.
Located in the middle of a residential area, the tumulus is not so easy to find.

sen.j: 『蛇塚』の名の由来について、石室内に蛇が棲んでいたことからと名付けられたと説明されることがある。
sen.e: The origin of the name, "Hebizuka" (a snake hill) is sometimes explained that snakes used to live in the stone chamber.
The origin of the name, "Hebizuka" (snake hill) is sometimes explained that snakes used to live in the stone chamber.
The origin of the name, "Hebizuka" (snake hill) is sometimes explained that snakes used to live in the stone chamber.

sen.j: また周囲が住宅地になる前は、空き地に石室がそびえている状態であった。
sen.e: Before the surrounding area turned into a residential district, the stone chamber towered high in an empty space.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Before the surrounding area turned into a residential district, the stone chamber towered high in an empty space.
Before the surrounding area turned into a residential district, the stone chamber towered high in an empty space.

sen.j: 石室に近づくことができた。
sen.e: It was easily accessible.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was easily accessible.
It was easily accessible.
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。

sen.j: かつて「いわや（岩屋）」と呼ばれていた時期がある。
sen.e: It was once called 'iwaya.'
It was once called 'iwaya.'
It was once called 'iwaya.'

sen.j: 石室の規模から蛇塚古墳はしばしば石舞台古墳と対比される。
sen.e: The Hebizuka-kofun Tumulus is often compared to the Ishibutai Tumulus in terms of the size of its stone chamber.
The Hebizuka-kofun Tumulus is often compared to the Ishibutai Tumulus in terms of the size of its stone chamber.
The Hebizuka-kofun Tumulus is often compared to the Ishibutai-kofun Tumulus in terms of the size of its stone chamber.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 石舞台古墳の石室は花崗岩であるが、蛇塚古墳の石室は堆積岩である。
sen.e: The latter's stone chamber is made of granite whereas the former's is made of sedimentary rock.
The latter's stone chamber is made of granite whereas the former is made of sedimentary rock.
The stone chamber of Ishibutai-kofun Tumulus is made of granite whereas the Hebizuka-kofun Tumulus is made of sedimentary rock.

sen.j: 蛇塚古墳の石室の天井石は失われている。
sen.e: The ceiling stone of the Hebizuka Tumulus has been lost.
The ceiling stone of the Hebizuka Tumulus has been lost.
The ceiling stone of the Hebizuka-kofun Tumulus has been lost.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: かつて東北に「蛇塚撮影所（面影撮影所）」と呼ばれる撮影所が存在した（後に大映オープンセットの一部となった嵐寛寿郎プロダクション太秦撮影所）。
sen.e: In the north-east of the tumulus, there used to be a studio named 'Hebizuka (Omokage) Film Studio,' (the Uzumasa Studio of Arashi Kanjuro Production, which later became a part of the open set of Daiei Film Company).

In the north-east of the tumulus, there used to be a studio named 'Hebizuka (Omokage) Film Studio,' (the Uzumasa Studio of Arashi Kanjuro Production, which later became a part of the open set of Daiei Film Company).

In the north-east of the tumulus, there used to be a studio named 'Hebizuka (Omokage) Film Studio,' (the Uzumasa Studio of Arashi Kanjuro Production, which later became a part of the open set of Daiei Film Company).

sen.j: 蛇塚古墳を初めてとして嵯峨野には数多くの古墳があったが、都市開発によって消滅したものが多い。
sen.e: There were many tumuli such as the Hebizuka Tumulus in Sagano, but most disappeared due to urban development.
There were many tumuli such as the Hebizuka Tumulus in Sagano, but most have disappeared due to urban development.
There were many tumuli such as the Hebizuka-kofun Tumulus in Sagano, but most have disappeared due to urban development.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 現存するものとしては以下のものがある。
sen.e: The extant tumuli are as follows.
The extant tumuli are as follows.
The extant tumuli are as follows.

sen.j: - 古墳時代後期、全長71mの前方後円墳。
sen.e: The Amazuka Tumulus is a keyhole-shaped mound with the total length of 71 m, built in the late Kofun period,
The Amazuka Tumulus is a keyhole-shaped mound with the total length of 71 m, built in the late Kofun period,
The Amazuka-kofun Tumulus is a keyhole-shaped mound with the total length of 71 m, built in the late Kofun period,
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 全長10メートルと7.5メートルの2つの横穴式石室を有する。
sen.e: It consists of two horizontal stone chambers of which one is 10 m long and the other is 7.5 m long.
It consists of two horizontal stone chambers of which one is 10 m long and the other is 7.5 m long.
It consists of two horizontal stone chambers of which one is 10 m long and the other is 7.5 m long.

sen.j: - 古墳時代後期、直径16mの円墳。
sen.e: The Chiyonomichi Tumulus is a round barrow with the diameter of 16 m.
The Chiyonomichi Tumulus is a round barrow with the diameter of 16 m.
The Chiyonomichi-kofun Tumulus is a round barrow with the diameter of 16 m, built in the late Kofun period.

sen.j: 横穴式石室を有する
sen.e: It has a horizontal stone chamber.
It has a horizontal stone chamber.
It has a horizontal stone chamber.

sen.j: - 雙ヶ岡（名勝）にある古墳時代中期の古墳群で、20基ほどある。
sen.e: Situated in Narabigaoka (national site of scenic beauty), the Narabigaoka Burial Mounds is a tumulus complex with 20 burial mounds built in the mid Kofun period.
Situated in Narabigaoka (national site of scenic beauty), the Narabigaoka Burial Mounds is a tumulus complex with 20 burial mounds built during the mid Kofun period.
Situated in Narabigaoka (scenic beauty), the Narabigaoka Burial Mounds is a tumulus complex with 20 burial mounds built during the mid Kofun period.

sen.j: 中でも1号墳（一ノ丘古墳）は直径44メートルの円墳である。
sen.e: Burial Mound 1 (Ichinooka-kofun Tumulus) in particular is a round barrow with the diameter of 44 m.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Burial Mound 1 (Ichinooka-kofun Tumulus) in particular is a round barrow with the diameter of 44 m.
Burial Mound No. 1 (Ichinooka-kofun Tumulus) in particular is a round barrow with the diameter of 44 m.

sen.j: 蛇塚古墳に匹敵する巨石を用いた横穴式石室を有する。
sen.e: It has a horizontal chamber made of a stone as gigantic as the one in the Hebizuka Tumulus.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It has a horizontal chamber made of a stone as gigantic as the one in the Hebizuka Tumulus.
It has a horizontal chamber made of a stone as gigantic as the one in the Hebizuka-kofun Tumulus.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: - 古墳時代後期。
sen.e: The burial mounds were constructed in the late Kofun period.
These burial mounds were constructed during the late Kofun period.
These burial mounds were constructed during the late Kofun period.

sen.j: 現存する4基の古墳のうち1号墳（円山古墳）、2号墳（入道塚古墳）は陵墓参考地。
sen.e: Of the 4 extant tumuli Burial Mound 1 (Maruyama-kofun Tumulus) and Burial Mound 2 (Nyudotsuka-kofun Tumulus) are designated as referable mausoleums.
Of the 4 extant tumuli Burial Mound 1 (Maruyama-kofun Tumulus) and Burial Mound 2 (Nyudotsuka-kofun Tumulus) are designated as referable mausoleums.
Of the four extant tumuli Burial Mound No. 1 (Maruyama-kofun Tumulus) and Burial Mound No. 2 (Nyudotsuka-kofun Tumulus) are designated as referable mausoleums.
sen.cmt: スペルアウトし補足しました。

tit.j: 垂箕山古墳（片平大塚古墳・仲野親王高畠陵）
tit.e: Tarumiyama-kofun Tumulus (Katahiraotsuka-kofun Tumulus and the Takabatake Mausoleum of Prince Nakano)
Tarumiyama-kofun Tumulus (Katahiraotsuka-kofun Tumulus and the Takabatake Mausoleum of Prince Nakano)
Tarumiyama-kofun Tumulus (Katahiraotsuka-kofun Tumulus and the Takabatake Mausoleum of Imperial Prince Nakano)

sen.j: - 蛇塚の北方500メートルにある前方後円墳、墳丘長75メートル。
sen.e: Located 500 m north of the Hebizuka Tumulus, the Tarumiyama Tumulus is a large keyhole-shaped mound with the length of 75 m.
Located 500 m north of the Hebizuka Tumulus, the Tarumiyama Tumulus is a large keyhole-shaped mound with a length of 75 m.
Located 500 m north of the Hebizuka-kofun Tumulus, the Tumulus is a large keyhole-shaped mound with a length of 75 m.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 蛇塚古墳と同じく古墳時代後期に属するが、築造は6世紀中葉とされる。
sen.e: Like the Hebizuka-kofun Tumulus, it is ascribed to the late Kofun period though it seems to have been constructed in the mid 6th century.
Like the Hebizuka-kofun Tumulus, it is ascribed to the late Kofun period though it seems to have been constructed during the mid 6th century.
Like the Hebizuka-kofun Tumulus, it is ascribed to the late Kofun period though it seems to have been constructed during the mid sixth century.
sen.cmt: スペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 垂箕山古墳は保存状態が良く、現在は宮内庁が管理している。
sen.e: Being well-preserved, it is currently managed by the Imperial Household Agency.
Being well-preserved, it is currently managed by the Imperial Household Agency.
Being well-preserved, it is currently managed by the Imperial Household Agency.
